Using Tana's Supertags with Search

Learn how to use Tana's supertags with live searches and create amazing workflows.

Article: Tana

Learn how to use Supertags in Tana

Understand the basics of how to use Tana's supertags.

Using Tana's Live Search Feature

Learn how to use Tana's live searches.

entry.content:
Article: Tana

Get oriented in Tana's UI

Get started with Tana by exploring its main UI and navigation features.

entry.title: Everything is a Node in Tana (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Tana

Everything is a Node in Tana

Learn how to use Tana's nodes.

entry.title: Data About Nodes - Fields and Tags in Tana (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Tana

Data About Nodes - Fields and Tags in Tana

Learn how to leverage Tana's fields and tags to record data about individual nodes.

entry.title: New Time Units for Higher Productivity (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Productivity

New Time Units for Higher Productivity

Our common measures of time never worked for me for time management. So I invented my own.

entry.title: The Input Channel Audit (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Attention Design

The Input Channel Audit

A quick How To guide for shaping your information diet

entry.title: Develop Strong Criteria for Input Triage (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Attention Design

Develop Strong Criteria for Input Triage

'How in the world. You need less Twitter in your life.' I had, again, discarded my guard rails of attention design and failed at input triage.

entry.title: The Seven Questions At The Heart Of Knowledge Ops (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Knowledge Ops

The Seven Questions At The Heart Of Knowledge Ops

Personal Knowledge Management is too restrictive – you want to think about all seven of these questions instead.

entry.title: The Grazing – Feeding Model of Information Gathering (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Knowledge Ops

The Grazing – Feeding Model of Information Gathering

On the Internet, information is limitless. The Grazing-Feeding Model of Information Gathering helps you know how you're engaging with that information.

entry.title: Sadly, Constraints Are Real (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Constraints

Sadly, Constraints Are Real

For the last 15 years I've ignored one fundamental truth: real constraints exist. Here's what I'm trying now.

entry.title: Adversarial Reading (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

Adversarial Reading

Bullshit is everywhere, and these algorithms of thought help you do more adversarial reading.

entry.title: How to improve a process (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Productivity

How to improve a process

With taking notes as an example, let's talk about how to improve any process.

entry.title: Don't Fiddle With Your Note-Taking System (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Note-taking

Don't Fiddle With Your Note-Taking System

You should stick to one note-taking system and fiddle with it as little as possible. That's a myth.

entry.title: Get Rid of Peer Review and Academic Journals (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Peer Review

Get Rid of Peer Review and Academic Journals

Why to get rid of peer review and academic journals as we know them – and possibly what to do instead.

entry.title: You Actually Need to Context Switch (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Productivity

You Actually Need to Context Switch

Common wisdom says that you need to avoid context switching. That's only half true – sometimes you need to context switch.

entry.title: How to Context Switch Like a Pro (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Productivity

How to Context Switch Like a Pro

Context switching is unavoidable – but you can make it less costly by combining a couple of simple strategies.

entry.title: A Tale of Two Biases: How To Read The News (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

A Tale of Two Biases: How To Read The News

Counter two frequent biases while reading the news: Selection Bias and Description Bias.

entry.title: How to use Roam Research for Interstitial Journaling (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Interstitial Journaling

How to use Roam Research for Interstitial Journaling

Interstitial Journaling is a great technique for minimizing context switching costs and staying productive. Here's how I use it in Roam Reserch.

entry.title: Why You Should Pick Zotero As A Reference Manager (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Academic Workflow

Why You Should Pick Zotero As A Reference Manager

A guide to reference managers, what you should expect from them and why Zotero is the reference manager you should use - whether you're in academia or not.

entry.title: Behavior First, Theory Second (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Learning

Behavior First, Theory Second

Behavior and Theory are two heuristics that can help you in deciding between courses and teachers.

entry.title: True Algorithms of Thought Have Arrived (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

True Algorithms of Thought Have Arrived

Can you imagine being able to transfer 'mental software' between people? It's now possible, by using Algorithms of Thought in Roam Research.

entry.title: The Power of Keystone Habits with Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Programming Attention

The Power of Keystone Habits with Roam Research

How to use Roam Research as your keystone habit to regularly revisit writing that is important to you, using the ∆ feature in Roam.

entry.title: Zotero and Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Academic Workflow

Zotero and Roam Research

A guide for using Roam Research together with Zotero to get the most out of your citation metadata.

entry.title: A short (preliminary) guide to Spaced Repetition in Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Spaced Repetition

A short (preliminary) guide to Spaced Repetition in Roam Research

How to use Roam Research's new Delta feature to do Spaced Repetition and never forget anything again.

entry.title: My grandfather's research technique - Index, Proto-Zettelkasten, Paper (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Zettelkasten

My grandfather's research technique - Index, Proto-Zettelkasten, Paper

My grandfather's way of doing history research before the computer age. Using paper and a meticulous process, he built something close to a Zettelkasten.

entry.title: How to cure Highlight Dementia (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

How to cure Highlight Dementia

How to make sure that you never lose insights when reading and highlighting. Because Highlight Dementia is completely preventable.

entry.title: Actor's Concepts and Inventing Discovery (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

Actor's Concepts and Inventing Discovery

How discovery became an actor's concept - and what you can use that for. Can you play chess without knowing that you are doing so?

entry.title: Getting Started with Algorithms of Thought (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

Getting Started with Algorithms of Thought

An introduction to Algorithms of Thought - how they differ from Mental Models and how to use them in Roam Research.

entry.title: Universal-X - Of Polymaths and other fantastic creatures (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Polymathy

Universal-X - Of Polymaths and other fantastic creatures

There are words you can't use to describe yourself without sounding like an utter ass. Imagine asking someone at a party who they are and they respond with 'Nice to meet you, I'm a brilliant photographer/physicist/writer' - instant, life-long friends you'll be, no?

entry.title: The Right to Disagree (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

The Right to Disagree

Contrary to popular belief, you can't just disagree with someone because you feel like it. You have to __earn__ the right to disagree with someone's position.

entry.title: A Gruvbox Theme for Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:

A Gruvbox Theme for Roam Research

How to create a Gruvbox-style color theme for Roam Research using Roam's built-in CSS capabilities.

entry.title: Kilohertz quasiperiodic oscillations in short gamma-ray bursts (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Kilohertz quasiperiodic oscillations in short gamma-ray bursts

Two signals identified in short gamma-ray bursts from archival Burst and Transient Source Experiment data show kilohertz quasiperiodic oscillations, implying the ringing of a hypermassive neutron star before collapsing to a black hole.

  • Cecilia Chirenti
  • Simone Dichiara
  • Robert Preece
Article 09 Jan 2023

entry.content:
Neonatal imprinting of alveolar macrophages via neutrophil-derived 12-HETE

  • Erwan Pernet
  • Sarah Sun
  • Maziar Divangahi
Article 04 Jan 2023

entry.title: Neogene burial of organic carbon in the global ocean (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Neogene burial of organic carbon in the global ocean

A ‘bottom-up’ approach for calculating the rate of organic carbon burial in the global ocean shows larger variability than has been previously estimated, suggesting that the organic carbon cycle acted as positive feedback of past global warming.

  • Ziye Li
  • Yi Ge Zhang
  • Benjamin J. W. Mills
Article 04 Jan 2023

entry.title: Structural basis of broad-spectrum β-lactam resistance in Staphylococcus aureus (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Structural basis of broad-spectrum β-lactam resistance in Staphylococcus aureus

Cryo-electron microscopy structures of Staphylococcus aureus BlaR1 reveal dynamic signalling states regulating broad spectrum β-lactam antibiotic resistance through cleavage of the transcriptional repressor BlaI and induced expression of the β-lactamase blaZ and the β-lactam-resistant cell-wall transpeptidase mecA.

  • J. Andrew N. Alexander
  • Liam J. Worrall
  • Natalie C. J. Strynadka
Article Open Access 04 Jan 2023

entry.title: Extreme redox variations in a superdeep diamond from a subducted slab (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Extreme redox variations in a superdeep diamond from a subducted slab

The authors investigate chemical anomalies in superdeep diamond inclusions, leading them to suggest that there is an extremely variable redox environment in the deep mantle.

  • Fabrizio Nestola
  • Margo E. Regier
  • Jeffrey W. Harris
Article 04 Jan 2023

entry.title: Papers and patents are becoming less disruptive over time (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Papers and patents are becoming less disruptive over time

A decline in disruptive science and technology over time is reported, representing a substantive shift in science and technology, which is attributed in part to the reliance on a narrower set of existing knowledge.

  • Michael Park
  • Erin Leahey
  • Russell J. Funk
Article 04 Jan 2023

entry.title: Metabolic regulation of species-specific developmental rates (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Metabolic regulation of species-specific developmental rates

An in vitro system that recapitulates temporal characteristics of embryonic development demonstrates that the different rates of mouse and human embryonic development stem from differences in metabolic rates and—further downstream—the global rate of protein synthesis.

  • Margarete Diaz-Cuadros
  • Teemu P. Miettinen
  • Olivier Pourquié
Article 04 Jan 2023

entry.title: Synaptic gradients transform object location to action (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Synaptic gradients transform object location to action

Analysis of behaviour, physiology, anatomy and connectomics in Drosophila shows how direction-specific visual information is transformed onto downstream premotor networks and converted into appropriate motor responses.

  • Mark Dombrovski
  • Martin Y. Peek
  • Gwyneth M. Card
Article Open Access 04 Jan 2023

entry.title: RNA targeting unleashes indiscriminate nuclease activity of CRISPR–Cas12a2 (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
RNA targeting unleashes indiscriminate nuclease activity of CRISPR–Cas12a2

Structural analysis of Cas12a2, a CRISPR-associated nuclease that nonspecifically cleaves ssRNA, ssDNA and dsDNA, reveals a complete activation pathway involved in the abortive infection system protecting cells against invasion.

  • Jack P. K. Bravo
  • Thomson Hallmark
  • David W. Taylor
Article Open Access 04 Jan 2023

entry.title: Structures and mechanisms of tRNA methylation by METTL1–WDR4 (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Structures and mechanisms of tRNA methylation by METTL1–WDR4

Using cryo-electron microscopy, structural and mechanistic insights into how the METTL1–WDR4 complex catalyses methylation of tRNAs are shown.

  • Victor M. Ruiz-Arroyo
  • Rishi Raj
  • Yunsun Nam
Article 04 Jan 2023

entry.title: Ultrathin quantum light source with van der Waals NbOCl2 crystal (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Ultrathin quantum light source with van der Waals NbOCl2 crystal

A van der Waals crystal, niobium oxide dichloride, with vanishing interlayer electronic coupling and considerable monolayer-like excitonic behaviour in the bulk, as well as strong and scalable second-order optical nonlinearity, is discovered, which enables a high-performance quantum light source.

  • Qiangbing Guo
  • Xiao-Zhuo Qi
  • Andrew T. S. Wee
Article 04 Jan 2023

entry.title: HIV silencing and cell survival signatures in infected T cell reservoirs (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
HIV silencing and cell survival signatures in infected T cell reservoirs

HIV-infected memory CD4 T cells under antiretroviral therapy are a distinctive population of cells with transcriptomic patterns that favour HIV silencing, cell survival and cell proliferation.

  • Iain C. Clark
  • Prakriti Mudvari
  • Eli A. Boritz
Article Open Access 04 Jan 2023

entry.title: A quantitative map of nuclear pore assembly reveals two distinct mechanisms (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
A quantitative map of nuclear pore assembly reveals two distinct mechanisms

Single-molecule calibrated live microscopy and computational modelling have revealed that human nuclear pore complex assembly takes different pathways during the exit from mitosis and during nuclear growth in interphase.

  • Shotaro Otsuka
  • Jeremy O. B. Tempkin
  • Jan Ellenberg
Article Open Access 04 Jan 2023
